Welcome to HistoricalDataProvider’s documentation!¶

HistoricalData controller¶

app.main.routes.get_stock_ticker_data()[source]¶

Get the historical data

This function allows the user to get the historical data of a stock from five years ago

Parameters:ticker (int) – ticker of the stock
Returns:json of historical data

  • Example

    GET http://127.0.0.1:5000/api/data?ticker=GOOG

  • Expected Success Response:

    [
    {
        "close_price":558.46,
        "date":"Thu, 27 Mar 2014 00:00:00 GMT",
        "highest_price":568.0,
        "lowest_price":552.92,
        "open_price":568.0,
        "stock_ticker":"GOOG",
        "volume":13052.0
    },
    {

    },
]

BackTesting controller¶

app.backtesting.routes.get_daily_returns()[source]¶

Gets all the daily returns of a portfolio. This function allows user to get the daily returns of a portfolio when backtested on historical data. The first entry for daily_returns is null. :return: results of the backtest - Example:

POST http://127.0.0.1:5000/api/daily_returns?window=50
'{
    "AAPL": 2,
    "TSLA": "7"
}'
  • Expected Success Response::
    {

    “1403481600000”: {

    “total_value”:1827.6768, “daily_returns”:53.2628,

    }, “1403568000000”: {

    “total_value”:1793.6248, “daily_returns”:-34.052,

    },

    }

app.backtesting.routes.get_moving_average()[source]¶

Gets all the computed moving average values of a portfolio. This function allows user to get the moving average values of a portfolio when backtested on historical data. The user can optionally define the window parameter (the default is 50). The first number of entries equal to the window size is null. :return: results of the backtest - Example:

POST http://127.0.0.1:5000/api/daily_returns?window=50
'{
    "AAPL": 2,
    "TSLA": "7"
}'
  • Expected Success Response::
    {

    1402531200000”: {

    “total_value”:1827.6768, “moving_average”:1581.275272

    },

    }

app.backtesting.routes.get_moving_standard_deviation()[source]¶

Gets all the computed moving standard deviation values of a portfolio. This function allows user to get the moving standard deviation values of a portfolio when backtested on historical data. The user can optionally define the window parameter (the default is 50). The first number of entries equal to the window size is null. :return: results of the backtest - Example:

POST http://127.0.0.1:5000/api/daily_returns?window=50
'{
    "AAPL": 2,
    "TSLA": "7"
}'
  • Expected Success Response::
    {

    1403481600000”: {

    “total_value”:1594.4634, “moving_standard_deviation”:90.1876341337

    },

    }

app.backtesting.routes.get_portfolio_statistics()[source]¶

Gets all portfolio statistics: daily returns, moving_average, moving_standard_deviation. This function allows user to get the results of a portfolio when backtested on historical data. Note that the first few entries for daily_returns, moving_average, and moving standard_deviation will be null. :return: results of the backtest - Example:

POST http://127.0.0.1:5000/api/backtest
'{
    "AAPL": 2,
    "TSLA": "7"
}'
  • Expected Success Response::
    {

    “1403481600000”: {

    “total_value”:1827.6768, “daily_returns”:53.2628, “moving_average”:1595.504664, “moving_standard_deviation”:90.1876341337

    }, “1403568000000”: {

    “total_value”:1793.6248, “daily_returns”:-34.052, “moving_average”:1600.118304, “moving_standard_deviation”:94.2947709698

    },

    }
